page.title: 11Beverley Boys Brigade
page.content:
The Boys Brigade was founded in 1883 by Sir William Smith in Glasgow. Boys of 6-7 years can join the Anchor Boys Section, 8-11 year old boys join the Junion Section, while 16-17 year old youths can enter the Company Section. Anchor Boys do art and craft. In the junior section the activities include badge-work, games, art and craft and there is the opportunity to go to camp. Company section members camp in the Isle of Man, where they learn to canoe and rock-climb amongst other outdoor activities. It is good fun and character building for boys. Most Boys Brigades have bands. Indoor activites include tying knots and learning to identify road signs.
Timothy Buescher aged 9
